N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6030.6 - Specifications

State Regulations

Vests shall be comfortable to wear throughout an entire
eight-hour shift, and shall meet the following minimum standards: (a) Each vest shall be of slip-over or
slip-on construction, and shall provide front and back protection. (b) Side protection or partial side
protection may be provided as an optional feature. (c) Front panels shall cover the entire front
of the body except where scooped at the armholes and neck and shall extend into
the shoulder area above the collarbone. (d) Back protection shall have a generally
rectangular shape fully covering the back area and with a minimum of scooping
at the neck. (e) Back panels shall
be of the same materials and construction as the remainder of the
vest. (f) Back panels shall not
overlap or infringe upon the front protection, or the front and side
protection, offered by the vest. (g) Front and back shirttails shall be a
optional feature, but, if provided, shall be of integral construction with the
vest. (h) Ballistic panels shall be
properly treated to be water repellent. (i) The length shall be such that, when worn
in the sitting position, the vest will not ride up on the wearer. (j) If shoulder straps are provided, they
shall be at least two inches wide at their minimum dimension. (k) Seams at the top of the shoulder area
shall be so constructed as to minimize chafing or other discomfort. (l) The ballistic panels shall be easily
removable to permit laundering of the carrier or cleaning of the ballistic
panels. (m) The neck cutout shall
be sufficiently scooped so that the vest is not visible at the open throat of
the shirt on a standing officer when the collar is unbuttoned and without a
tie. (n) All seams and stitching
shall be consistent with good garment manufacturing processes. (o) The vests shall contain no metal
components. (p) Threads for all
stitching shall not shrink during washing so as to cause puckering of the
material. (q) Each vest shall
provide sufficient armhole room so as not to irritate or restrict
movement. (r) Ballistic panels
shall lie flat in the carriers without bulging of the carrier at any point or
with no more than one-fourth inch of clearance between the carrier and the
ballistic panel around the periphery of the panel. (s) Each vest shall be free from wrinkles, blisters, cracks or fabric tears, crazing, chipped or sharp corners, or other
evidences of inferior workmanship. Notes
